info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 24 at 4:10AM PDT until October 25 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 PM PDT WEDNESDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Wet snow expected at elevations as low as 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches at elevations between 4000 and 5000 feet, and 4 to 10 inches above 5000 feet. Southwest to west winds gusting at 20 to 40 mph. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades and Southern Oregon Cascades, from Lake of the Woods northward. Impacts will be mainly around Crater Lake, but also including Willamette Pass, Diamond Lake, and Lake of the Woods. This includes portions of highways 140, 62, 230, 138, and 58. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 9 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, primarily early Wednesday morning, and with colder temperatures behind the snow late Wednesday night. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will be near 5500 to 6500 feet as precipitation begins late this afternoon. Snow levels will fall overnight to around 3500 to 4500 feet, then remain near that level through Wednesday evening. Snowfall rates will be highest late tonight into Wednesday morning. During this early season event, accumulation will be mainly off of paved surfaces with snow melting as it hits roadways. This will still create slippery roadways, including with freezing temperatures as snow tapers off late Wednesday night. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
